meanings.definition: The quality or state of being pathogenic.
meanings.sent1: The pathogenicities of the virus were evident in the rapid spread of illness.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the pathogenicities of different bacteria to understand how diseases spread.
meanings.sent3: The pathogenicities of the bacteria seemed to have a party in my stomach, causing quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The pathogenicities of the virus were like invisible villains attacking the body.
meanings.sent5: The pathogenicities of the fungus were so strong that they overpowered the immune system.

meanings.definition: The ability of a microorganism to cause disease.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the pathogenicities of various pathogens is crucial for developing effective treatments.
meanings.sent2: Doctors need to consider the pathogenicities of different viruses when diagnosing patients.
meanings.sent3: The pathogenicities of the bacteria were like tiny troublemakers wreaking havoc in the body.
meanings.sent4: The pathogenicities of the virus were a silent threat lurking in the environment.
meanings.sent5: The pathogenicities of the parasite were so cunning that they outsmarted the body's defenses.
